contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Protected area | name = Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park | photo = | photo_caption = Swans and Geese under a stormy sky at Lac Cardinal | iucn_category = | map = AB-national and provincial parks.png | map_width = 200 | map_caption = Location of Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park in [[Alberta]] | locator_x = 95 | locator_y = 92 | location = [[Peace No. 135, Alberta|Peace No. 135]], [[Alberta]], [[Canada]] | nearest_city = [[Grimshaw, Alberta|Grimshaw]] | lat_d = 56 | lat_m = 13 | lat_s = 43 | lat_NS = N | long_d = 117 | long_m = 41 | long_s = 22 | long_EW = W | scale = 50000 | area = {{convert|0.8|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} | established = March 01, 1956 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | governing_body = [[Alberta Tourism, Parks and Recreation ]] }} '''Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park''' is a [[provincial park]] in [[Alberta]], [[Canada]], located {{convert|10|km|mi|abbr=on}} north-west of [[Grimshaw, Alberta|Grimshaw]] in [[northern Alberta]], west of the junction of [[Alberta Highway 2|Highway 2]] and [[Mackenzie Highway]]. It was named ''Lac Cardinal Provincial Park'', and was renamed to Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park in 1978, to commemorate [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|the monarch]]'s visit.<ref>{{Cite web| url= http://www.cd.gov.ab.ca/enjoying_alberta/parks/planning/gateway/siteinformation.asp?id=110 | title= Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park | author= Alberta Community Development | authorlink= Alberta Community Development | year= 2005 | accessdate= 2007-03-06}}</ref> The park is situated on the eastern shore of [[Cardinal Lake]], at an elevation of {{convert|640|m|ft|abbr=on}} and has a surface of {{convert|0.8|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}}. It was established on March 1, 1956 and is maintained by [[Alberta Tourism, Parks and Recreation]]. ==Activities== The following activities are available in the park:<ref>{{Cite web| author=Alberta Tourism, Parks, Recreation & Culture| url=http://gateway.cd.gov.ab.ca/siteactivities.aspx?id=110| title= Activities in Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park|accessdate=2007-07-14}}</ref> *[[Beach]] activities (including [[swimming (sport)|swimming]] and [[volleyball]]) *[[Birdwatching]] (141 bird species have been observed) *[[Camping]] *[[Canoeing]] and [[kayaking]] *[[Cross-country skiing]] ({{convert|4.5|km|mi}} non-groomed trails) *Front country [[hiking]] *[[Horseshoes]] *Power [[boating]], [[sailing]], [[water-skiing]] and [[windsurfing]] ==See also== *[[List of Alberta provincial parks]] *[[List of Canadian provincial parks]] *[[List of National Parks of Canada]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Cite web| author= Alberta Tourism, Parks, Recreation & Culture| authorlink=Alberta Community Development| url=http://gateway.cd.gov.ab.ca/siteinformation.aspx?id=110| title= Queen Elizabeth Provincial Park|accessdate=2007-07-14}} {{Alberta parks}} [[Category:Parks in Alberta]] [[Category:Peace No. 135, Alberta]] {{Alberta-protected-area-stub}}
